entries.name: Description
entries: Descendants of the first humans to cross the shores of Ash'ahla, the Ash'a are a fiercely pious people with a deep connection to Meridian's magic.
Enamored with Ash'ahla's many wonders and enchanted by its immortal god-Queen, the Ash’a are devout in worship and feverishly protective of their new homeland.
Very few Ash’a openly dare to question Aurora or her commandments or Aurora’s place as a god. Those that do swiftly find the Shadar-kai darkening their doorstep.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Ash'a Druid
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: An Ash'a druid casting flame.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and usually live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Children of Miira
entries: You know the druidcraft cantrip. Furthermore, if you have the Spellcasting or the Pact Magic class feature, the spells on the table below are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class.

entries.name: Cling to Life
entries: When you make a death saving throw and roll 16 or higher, you regain 1 hit point.

entries.name: Description
entries: The Nyx are divided into two tribes: sea faring islanders and the nomadic gypsies. Both hail from the Fractured Sea, Nyxen tend to be bulky, pale skin with curly hair. These humans are deeply passionate people at their best and blood-curdling warriors at their worst. Their communities are faithful purveyors of the arts with strong familial ties.
Nyxen tribes were first to lose their ancestral home, Arxyk, to the invading elves and the still contaminated land fuels ancenstral resentment even now.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Ash'a Druid
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: An Ash'a druid casting flame.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and usually live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Savage Blow
entries: As a bonus action, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can force the creature to succeed on a constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced to 0 until the end of their next turn. If the target fails by 5 or more, they are instead stunned for the same duration. The save DC for this attack is 10 + your proficiency bonus. Once you use this trait, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Northern Toughness
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Description
entries: Amenmaatra, capital of Egress and famed Gateway to the South is said to be the birthplace of the Siiq - a desertfolk spread across all four major deserts.
Tribal Siiq are proud warriors that thrive on trade through steep taxes to travelers between north and south Meridian.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Ash'a Druid
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: An Ash'a druid casting flame.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and usually live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Ambusher
entries: On your first turn in combat, your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks, and you have advantage on attack rolls against creatures who have not yet acted.

entries.name: War Hero
entries: You can use this trait to take the {@action Help} action as a bonus action, and you can do so a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Starting at 3rd level, choose one of the options below each time you take the {@action Help} action with this trait:

items.name: Hospitality
items.entry: You and the creature you help each gain a number of temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Passage
items.entry: You and the creature you help each increase your walking speeds by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Spite
items.entry: Until the start of your next turn, the first time the creature you help hits a target with an attack roll, that target has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes within the next minute.

entries.name: Description
entries: With sun-kissed skin and green eyes, Thesians pride themselves in being the most civilized of the human cultures - trading mysticsm and folklore for innovation and invention. After the fall of the elven empire, Thesians and high elves came together along Meridian's western shores to construct Polythesis - Meridian's first democracy.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and usually live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Lucky
entries: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

entries.name: Silver Tongue
entries: You have mastered the art of persuasion. If you fail a persuasion or deception check, as long as the creature that can hear you and the two you share the same language, you can choose to succeed instead. Once you use this trait, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Description
entries: Also known as Sun kin, High Elves are the most common elves in Meridian. They have tanned skin and dark features like wood elves, though tend to be taller and slenderer. High elves are deeply ingrained in the world compared to the other elves, holding positions of political and economic power throughout the world, especially in Thesian society.

entries.name: Age
entries: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood around the age of 40 and can live to be 150 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Elven Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|phb}, {@item shortsword|phb}, {@item shortbow|phb}, and {@item longbow|phb}.

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list|spells|level=0|class=Wizard}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write one extra language of your choosing.

entries.name: Description
entries: With a talent for engineering, Amechisil (meaning literally `moon elf`) or Mech for short, hold themselves to high esteem and even higher expectations. Most commonly found in the southern nations, where their natural gifts for engineering and logic are appreciated, moon elves have a long history of segregation even from other elves. Moon elves are unmistakable for their fair skin, blond hair, and ethereal features (which are almost cliché).

entries.name: Age
entries: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood around the age of 40 and can live to be 150 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Elven Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Incisive Sense
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Investigation} skill.

entries.name: Industrial Legacy
entries: You know the {@spell mending} cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell identify} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Once you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell unseen servant} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Description
entries: Easily recognizable by their intricate birthmarks, woods elves are most found in the south, where they use harness biotechnology for a variety of purposes, such as healing, natural construction, and yes… genetic testing. Their methods have been condemned frequently for questionable ethics. Wood elf technology is a staple of Furborn weapons, armor and daily lifestyle.

entries.name: Age
entries: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood around the age of 40 and can live to be 150 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Elven Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|phb}, {@item shortsword|phb}, {@item shortbow|phb}, and {@item longbow|phb}.

entries.name: Fleet of Foot
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Description
entries: With near black skin and beaded eyes, dark elves are the most religious of elves – keeping reverence to the Elven Lords. While common enough throughout the world, dark elves are commonly found in religious sanctuaries high in the mountains left to their own holy devices.

entries.name: Age
entries: Although most elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood around the age of 40 and can live to be 200 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Elven Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the depths of the underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Light Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Dark Magic
entries: You know the {@spell dancing lights} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell faerie fire} spell once with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell darkness} spell once per day with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Elven Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with {@item rapier|phb|rapiers}, {@item shortsword|phb|shortswords}, and {@item hand crossbow|phb|hand crossbows}.

entries.name: Description
entries: When the elves first arrived at Meridian, their inability to procreate led them down many ethically questionable paths to survival. One such path, cloning, unintentionally bred the sea elves. Sea elves, called so because of their translucent gel-like skin, are a genetically unstable, hermaphroditic subspecies capable of both sexual and asexual reproduction. Most sea elves reproduce through self-cloning, but there are rare occasions when they cross with other mates.
Mating with another elven subspecies always yields sea-elf offspring, while half sea-elves come from human-elf relations.

entries.name: Age
entries: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood around the age of 40 and can live to be 150 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Elven Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Animal Enhancement
entries: Your body is genetically unstable and will occasionally incorporate new and unusual characteristics. You choose one enhancement now and a second enhancement at 5th level.
At 1st level, choose one of the following options:

items.name: Earth Walk
items.entry: You can move across difficult terrain without expending extra movement.

items.name: Nimble Climber
items.entry: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

items.name: Underwater Adaptation
items.entry: You can breathe air and water, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

items.name: Limited Telepathy
items.entry: You can send telepathic messages to any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand these messages, but it must be able to understand at least one language. This process of communication is slow and limited, allowing you to transmit and receive only simple ideas and straightforward concepts.

entries: At 5th level, your body evolves further, developing new characteristics. Choose one of the options you didn't take at 1st level, or one of the following options:

items.name: Change Appearance
items.entry: As an action, you can change your appearance and your voice. This transformation lasts for 1 hour, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a free action. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight, but not so much that your size changes. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing and equipment aren't changed by this trait. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Natural Armor
items.entry: You have tough, scaly skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor. Furthermore, you have proficiency in athletics.

items.name: Fury
items.entry: When you damage a single creature with an attack or a spell, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage equals your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest. Furthermore, you have proficiency in intimidation.

entries.name: Description
entries: It took countless years and experiments for the dying star elves to successfully breed with humans and create the first half-elves. Their success saved their people, half-elves are now the second dominate race in the world, after humans.

entries.name: Age
entries: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood around the age of 40 and can live to be 150 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Elven Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Child of Miira
entries: If you have the Spellcasting or the Pact Magic class feature, the spells on the Child of Miira Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class.

entries.name: Silver Tongue
entries: You have mastered the art of persuasion. If you fail a persuasion or deception check, as long as the creature that can hear you and the two you share the same language, you can choose to succeed instead. Once you use this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Death Touch
entries: You can focus your deadly touch against your foes. As an action, make one unarmed strike. On a hit, the target takes an additional 1d10 necrotic damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

entries.name: Savage Blow
entries: As a bonus action, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can force the creature to succeed on a constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced to 0 until the end of their next turn. If the target fails by 5 or more, they are instead stunned until the end of their next turn. The save DC for this attack is 10 + your proficiency bonus. Once you use this trait, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Description
entries: While their houses are less established than Pride houses, the Lynx are still very much a proactive part of Furborn society. Their agility, stealth and ability to climb even vertical surfaces make them prime candidates for many unscrupulous trades. Lynx houses are extremely secretive about their family alliances, preferring to remain flexible for opportunities to increase their own standing.

entries.name: Age
entries: Furborn mature and age at about the same rate as humans.

entries.name: Size
entries: Lynx are taller on average than humans and relatively slender. Your size is Small or Medium and you choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Cat's Talents
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} and {@skill Stealth} skills.

entries.name: Cat's Claws
entries: Because of your claws, you have a climbing speed of 20 feet. In addition, your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Feline Agility
entries: Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

entries.name: Description
entries: Members of the Pride have features like lions, tigers and other large felines. Their physicality helped them establish the strongest Noble Houses over the years, especially during the reign of the Zeméri empire. Pride members are expected to contribute to their family name at all costs with the penalty of shame being banishment and even death.

entries.name: Age
entries: Furborn mature and age at about the same rate as humans.

entries.name: Size
entries: Prideborn are typically over 6 feet tall, with some standing over 7 feet. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Agressive
entries: As a bonus action, you can move up to your movement speed toward a hostile creature you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Daunting Roar
entries: As a bonus action, you can let out an especially menacing roar. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn. The DC of the save equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Hunter's Instincts
entries: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Perception}, or {@skill Survival}.

entries.name: Description
entries: Snakeskin Scaleborn are less identifiable than their Lizard-like cousins. With only patches of clear flesh-colored scales and thin tendrils for hair that is easily hidden disguised, Snakeskin Scaleborn will often pass for human. The reference to being “Snakes” does not refer to any relation to snakes, but instead refers to an old racial insult; “snake” as in untrustworthy or deceitful. Like Lizardskin Scaleborn, they are also driven by self-mastery, using their natural cunning and intellect to master whatever skill interests them.

entries.name: Age
entries: Scaleborn mature slower than humans do, reaching maturity around age 30. Their life span is typically 100 years, with some living to age 150.

entries.name: Size
entries: Skinnier in nature, Snakeskin range between 5 to 6 feet. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Viper's Dispassion
entries: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

entries.name: Genetic Memory
entries: You temporarily remember glimpses of the past, faded memories from ancestral lives ages ago. When you make an ability check that uses a skill, you can roll a d6 immediately after seeing the number on the d20 and add the number on the d6 to the check. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Infiltrator
entries: As a bonus action, you can let out an especially menacing roar. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn. The DC of the save equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Description
entries: Lizardskin Scaleborn are Lizardskin humanoids with thick hides and powerful builds. Lizardskin Scaleborn excel in physical prowess and may spend their considerable life spans find and mastering in as many fighting styles as they can – pushing their bodies to the absolute limit. Many find work as soldiers and athletes, though a rare few will focus on intellectual and creative arts to distinguish themselves from others of their kind. Despite these attempts, even the most restrained Lizardskin Scaleborn are quick to temper and ferocious in battle.

entries.name: Age
entries: Scaleborn mature slower than humans do, reaching maturity around age 30. Their life span is typically 100 years, with some living to age 150.

entries.name: Size
entries: Scaleborn are typically over 6 feet tall, with some standing over 7 feet. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Hungry Jaws
entries: You can throw yourself into a feeding frenzy. As a bonus action, you can make a special attack with your Bite. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries: You can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes at a time.

entries.name: Hunter's Instincts
entries: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Perception}, or {@skill Survival}.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You have tough, scaly skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Description
entries: Seaborn, also known as Naga, are rarely seen among surface dwellers. Their alien physiology only allows for a few Naga to live on land, isolating Naga society from the rest of the world. Although they are the most mysterious race, it is common knowledge that they are fierce enemies of the sea elves.

entries.name: Age
entries: Naga reach maturity around age 15 and can live up to 200 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Naga are slightly shorter than humans, averaging about 5 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Child of the Sea
entries: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet, and you can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Guardian of the Depths
entries: Adapted to even the most extreme ocean depths, you have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Light Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Poisonous Skin
entries: As a bonus action, you can release a powerful toxin from your pores for 1 minute. Any creature  that grapples you or comes into direct contact with your skin must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature no longer in direct contact with you can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Description
entries: I am.

entries.name: Age
entries: Sigri reach maturity around age 15 and can live up to 100 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Sigri are slightly shorter than humans, averaging about 5 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Child of the Sea
entries: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet, and you can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Ocean Born
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Control Air and Water
entries: You can cast {@spell fog cloud} with this trait. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell gust of wind} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell water walk} spell with it. Once you cast any of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Description
entries: With hard pale skin and dense muscles, even the smallest Stoneborn towers over most other races. They are generally a tribal people who prefer keeping their traditions apart from outsiders. Yet, as time passes and generations become more connected to the outside world, increasingly Stoneborn have found roles as ambassadors to their people.

entries.name: Age
entries: Stoneborn have lifespans comparable to humans. They enter adulthood in their late teens and usually live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: Goliaths are between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh between 280 and 340 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Natural Athlete
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} skill.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries: You have resistance to cold damage. You're also acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet.

entries.name: Desert Born
entries: You have resistance to fire damage. This feature replaces the Mountain Born feature.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: Description
entries: Nightbloods have always been revered as holy priests in Uruban. As children and without a choice, they are sent away to join the Death Cleric cloisters far removed from the rest of the world. Not all Nightbloods choose to accept their path and escape into hiding, keeping their blood hidden from the world.

entries.name: Age
entries: Stoneborn have lifespans comparable to humans. They enter adulthood in their late teens and usually live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: Stoneborn are between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh between 280 and 340 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Black Blood Healing
entries: The black blood that is a sign of your people's connection to Udreth-Sol boosts your natural healing. When you roll a 1 or 2 on any Hit Die you spend at the end of a short rest, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries: You have resistance to cold damage. You're also acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet.

entries.name: Desert Born
entries: You have resistance to fire damage. In hot hot, dry weather, you can survive drinking a single gallon of water a day without suffering any ill effects. This feature replaces the Mountain Born feature.

entries.name: Stone's Endurance
entries: You can focus yourself to occasionally shrug off injury. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a d12. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled and reduce the damage by that total. After you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Night-blood Ceremony
entries: You can cast protection from good and evil and ceremony with this trait, providing material components, using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability for them. Once you cast either spell, you can't cast it again with this trait until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Description
entries: Wren are a commonly found flying throughout in the Stonewood Valiant and other the mountain regions in Meridian. While many choose to live their entire lives as a part of the Stonewood nation, protected from the outside world, others leave to find work as scouts and mercenaries, using their aerial advantage over their enemies.

entries.name: Age
entries: Skyborn have lifespans comparable to humans. They enter adulthood in their late teens and usually live into their 80s.

entries.name: Size
entries: Wren range from 5 to 6 feet tall, but their bodies are slender and their bones are partially hollow to facilitate their flight. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Flight
entries: You have a flying speed of 30 feet. You can't use your flying speed while you wear medium or heavy armor. (If your campaign uses the variant rule for encumbrance, you can't use your flying speed if you are encumbered.)

entries.name: Hawkeyed
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill. In addition, attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls.

entries.name: Description
entries: Born without wings, Blackwren are ostracized from traditional society. This inferiority can drive Blackwren towards proving themselves in unexpected ways. Blackwren thrive in the outskirts of society where they can use their overlooked status to make a name for themselves in the most unexpected places.

entries.name: Age
entries: Skyborn have lifespans comparable to humans. They enter adulthood in their late teens and usually live into their 80s.

entries.name: Size
entries: Blackwren stand from 4 to 5 feet tall, but their bodies are slender and their bones are partially hollow to facilitate their flight. Your size is Small or Medium and you choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, you have advantage on attack rolls against any creature who is surprised.

entries.name: Blackwren Talents
entries: Thanks to your supernaturally good memory, you have proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Saving Face
entries: Blackwren are careful not to show weakness in front of their allies, for fear of losing status. If you miss with an attack roll or fail an ability check or a saving throw, you can gain a bonus to the roll equal to the number of allies you can see within 30 feet of you (maximum bonus of +5). Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Description
entries: Soldiers from a forgotten age, the Marksmen are technologically enhanced humanoids forged and controlled by an ancient elven construct known only as the Authority. Generation I Marksmen are built for endurance.

entries.name: Age
entries: Potential Marksmen can start their new life at any time after racial maturity. Once the process is complete, Marksmen have shown no sign of deterioration due to age. You are immune to magical aging effects.

entries.name: Size
entries: Most Marksmen stand between 5 and 6½ feet tall. Build is affected by your subrace. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude and have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.

entries.name: Integrated Protection
entries: Your body has built-in defensive layers, which give you a +1 bonus to Armor Class.

entries.name: Specialized Design
entries: You gain one skill proficiency and one tool proficiency of your choice.

entries.name: Description
entries: Soldiers from a forgotten age, the Marksmen are technologically enhanced humanoids forged and controlled by an ancient elven construct known only as the Authority. Generation II Marksmen are built for power.

entries.name: Age
entries: Potential Marksmen can start their new life at any time after racial maturity. Once the process is complete, Marksmen have shown no sign of deterioration due to age. You are immune to magical aging effects.

entries.name: Size
entries: Most Marksmen stand between 5 and 6½ feet tall. Build is affected by your subrace. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Elemental Configuration
entries: Choose one damage type from force, lightning, radiant, or thunder. This determines the damage types of other traits below.

entries.name: Concussion Beam
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can replace one of your attacks with a blast of energy from your arm in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes {@dice 2d8} damage of the type associated with your Elemental Configuration on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. This damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 3d8}), 11th level ({@dice 4d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 5d8}).
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Integrated Resistance
entries: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your Elemental Configuration. Furthermore, starting at 5th level, as an action, you can create an energy shield to protect yourself. For 1 minute, you become immune to the damage type associated with your Elemental Configuration. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Description
entries: Soldiers from a forgotten age, the Marksmen are technologically enhanced humanoids forged and controlled by an ancient elven construct known only as the Authority. Generation III Markmen are known as mage-slayers.

entries.name: Age
entries: Potential Marksmen can start their new life at any time after racial maturity. Once the process is complete, Marksmen have shown no sign of deterioration due to age. You are immune to magical aging effects.

entries.name: Size
entries: Most Marksmen stand between 5 and 6½ feet tall. Build is affected by your subrace. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Magician's Judge
entries: You know the true strike cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell silence} spell as a 2nd-level spell; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. Once you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell dispel magic} spell; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Automated Serenity
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

entries.name: Automated Defense
entries: You activate a force field as an action. You gain a +4 bonus to AC, and you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While the shield is active, your speed is 0 and can't increase, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, you can not take reactions, and the only action you can take is a bonus action to release the field.

entries.name: Description
entries: Unlike Marksmen who sacrifice both their memories and biology for technological enhancements, the Unmarked are entirely artificial. No one knows which of the elves designed the Unmarked or released them into the world, but they are unlike all other races on Meridian. While their range of emotion may be limited, the Unmarked have an endless capacity for growth and are slowly evolving in new and unimaginable ways.

entries.name: Age
entries: The Unmarked have no memory of their exact age and have shown no signs of deterioration due to age. You are immune to magical aging effects.

entries.name: Size
entries: Unmarked are created in the image of elves and share the same average height and weight. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Construct.

entries.name: Elven Tech
entries: As an artificial race, you do not study a spell book nor cast spells and/or other magical effects. Instead, you work with your tools and create the specialized items you'll use to produce your spell-like effects. You are unable to use magical consumables, such as potions and scrolls, but not from utilizing other advanced tech.

entries.name: Automated Healing
entries: Your artificial body has supernatural healing capabilities.
If you have 0 hit points at the start of your turn, you can regain hit points equal to your character level plus your proficiency bonus.
You can activate this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Artificial Nature
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:

items.entry: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 6 hours if you spend those hours in an inactive, motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.

entries.name: Tireless Precision
entries: You are proficient in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Sleight of Hand}.  You are also proficient with one tool of your choice.
Whenever you make an ability check with the chosen skill or tool, roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the check's total.

entries.name: Artificial Intelligence
entries: You have advantage on all Wisdom saving throws.
